S3 method for plotting RCT_predict results

Source: R/rct-predict-S3.R
plot.bmbstats_RCT_predict.Rd

S3 method for plotting RCT_predict results

# S3 method for bmbstats_RCT_predict
plot(x, type = "residuals", ...)

Arguments

x

Object of class bmbstats_RCT_predict
type

Type of plot. Options are "residuals", "prediction", "bias-variance", "pdp+ice", "counterfactual", and "ice". Default is "residuals"
...

Extra arguments. Use control argument and plot_control function to control plotting style. confidence for setting confidence level, metric for selecting performance metric (default is "RMSE") and metric_CV for selecting source of CV metrics (defaults is "testing.pooled"). For "pdp+ice", use predictor to select predictor for plotting (default is group parameter from RCT_predict).

Examples

data("vertical_jump_data")

m1 <- cv_model(
  `Post-test` ~ `Pre-test` + Group,
  vertical_jump_data,
  control = model_control(
    cv_repeats = 10,
    cv_folds = 3,
    cv_strata = vertical_jump_data$Group
  )
)
#> Cross-validating: 3 folds, 10 repeats
#> Done!

m1_rct <- RCT_predict(
  m1,
  new_data = vertical_jump_data,
  outcome = "Post-test",
  group = "Group",
  treatment_label = "Treatment",
  control_label = "Control"
)

m1_rct
